main event: Multiple oval-shaped objects, like two saucers cupped together, were observed in a direct line formation and evenly spaced. They were initially stationary for 40 minutes before shooting skyward at infinite speed and disappearing.
interesting points: The objects were described as having a metallic finish and were the size of an aircraft.
After being stationary for 40 minutes, the objects simultaneously shot skyward at infinite speed and vanished, leaving a negative trail exhaust.
The observation was made at coordinates 10 degrees 54 minutes N, 105 degrees 35' W, at approximately 13,000 feet elevation, with an estimated lateral distance of 6 miles to the objects.
A reliable witness from the GRAYBAR ELECTRIC COMPANY in Denver, CO reported clear sky and 65 mph winds from the SE at the observation point.
The objects remained motionless for 42 minutes before their disappearance.
sighted object: multiple oval-shaped metallic objects in a direct line formation
witnesses: reliable witness from GRAYBAR ELECTRIC COMPANY
